title: Seminar Demonstrates Advanced Microsoft Excel Techniques for Financial Professionals in Philadelphia, New York and Toronto
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/3/2015 @ 12:42 PM Companies mentioned in this article: Excel4apps 
PITTSBURGH -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- As Microsoft Excel celebrates its 30 th anniversary this September, users in Philadelphia, New York and Toronto can hone their spreadsheet skills at no-cost “Power Excel” seminars full of shortcuts based on years of experience from Bill Jelen, host of MrExcel.com . 
These information-packed interactive half-day seminars earn two Continuing Professional Education (CPE) credits and are an extension of sessions held in other cities. They are offered in conjunction with Excel4apps , a provider of best-in-class Excel-based inquiry and reporting software for use with SAP and Oracle. 
“Accountants, finance and business analysts, and any other professionals who want to optimize their use of Excel will benefit from – and enjoy – this dynamic seminar, and we’re excited to present Jelen’s unique expertise to additional cities,” said Chris Meyer, President Americas and Europe, Excel4apps. “Excel is a daily reality in finance and other disciplines, which is why it serves as the familiar interface to complex ERP systems in our products.” 
Attendees of the MrExcel Tips & Tricks Seminar will receive Jelen’s visual Q&A reference book that solves 527 Excel mysteries. Topics will include pivot tables, data visualization and analysis, data menu, Excel 2013 features, and Excel-based reporting. Also, a cocktail networking event and iPad Mini raffle follows the training. The September tour dates and locations are: 
Philadelphia
